column1: The emergence of Interactive Digital Television (iDTV) opened a set of technological possibilities that go beyond those offered by conventional TV. Among these opportunities we can highlight interactive contents that run together with linear TV program (television service where the viewer has to watch a scheduled TV program at the particular time it is offered and on the particular channel it is presented on). However
column2: developing interactive contents for this new platform is not as straightforward as
column4: developing Internet applications. One of the options to make this development process easier and safer is to use an iDTV simulator. However
column5: after having investigated some of the existing iDTV simulation environments
column6: we have found a limitation: these simulators mainly present solutions focused on the TV receiver
column7: whose interactive content must be loaded in advance by the programmer to a local repository (eg
column10: in this paper
column11: we propose a tool
column12: named BiS (Broadcast iDTV content Simulator)
column13: which makes possible a broader solution for the simulation of interactive contents. It allows simulating the transmission of interactive content along with the linear TV program (simulating the transmission of content over the air and in broadcast to the receivers). To enable this
column14: we defined a generic and easy-to-customize communication protocol that was implemented in the tool. The proposed environment differs from others because it allows simulating reception of both linear content and interactive content while running Java applications to allow such a content presentation.

01: Contextual Information Improving IPTV and Digital TV: A Systematic Review
Proceedings of the 20th Brazilian Symposium on Multimedia and the Web

This paper presents the results obtained from a systematic literature review that aimed at mapping current research studies that use contextual information to improve the TV watching experience or propose some interesting approach using the TV environment. We followed the orientations of literature for elaboration of three Research Questions: What contextual elements are used IPTV/DTV services? How contextual information used by IPTV/DTV services is acquired? Which types of solutions are being proposed in those approaches? We end the paper presenting our conclusions and opportunities for further work.
Contextual Information Improving IPTV and Digital TV: A Systematic Review

Simpósio Brasileiro de Sistemas Multimídia e Web (WebMedia)

A Ginga Code Development Network ou simplesmente GingaCDN é uma rede de desenvolvedores de componentes e aplicações para o middleware brasileiro de TV Digital Ginga. Esta iniciativa faz parte do programa Centro de Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento em Tecnologias Digitais para Informação e Comunicação (CTIC)
column2: atualmente incubado pela Rede Nacional de Ensino e Pesquisa (RNP)
column3: criado pelo governo federal com o objetivo de desenvolver a competência nacional para inovação em comunicações digitais. Este artigo procura descrever a experiência de desenvolvimento distribuído e colaborativo utilizada no projeto através da definição de um modelo de processo de desenvolvimento e construção e uso de ferramentas específicas.

01: Giga-Colab: Uma Arquitetura de Ambiente Virtual Colaborativo com suporte a Serviços Multimídia
Anais do IV Simpósio Brasileiro de Sistemas Colaborativos SBSC 2007

The development of collaborative and multimedia systems is a complex task and one of the key challenges is to promote the reuse and integration of those two software categories in the same environment. This paper presents an extensible collaborative virtual environment architecture based on client-server model
column2: taking advantage of a service oriented approach and open multimedia standards (ISMA
column3: H. 323 and SIP). To validate this proposal
column4: a prototype of a collaborative virtual environment was developed
column5: supporting two multimedia applications: video on demand and videoconference. The project had as target the Giga Network (RNP/CPqD) and had as its main requirement the support of high definition video
column6: resulting in some challenging issues to overcome.

column1: Resumo. Desenvolver sistemas colaborativos e multimídia é uma tarefa bastante complexa e um dos principais desafios é promover a reutilização e integração dessas duas categorias de software num mesmo ambiente. Neste contexto
column2: apresentamos uma arquitetura de um ambiente virtual colaborativo extensível baseada no modelo cliente-servidor

column1: 01: Implementing an Adaptation Layer for Multimedia Servers Using Aspect-Oriented Programming
Proceedings of the 12th Brazilian Symposium on Multimedia and the web

This work proposes an architecture for an adaptation layer working in multimedia servers. The architecture is designed using aspect-oriented programming techniques. We have implemented and validated the architecture of the proposed adaptation layer through the instantiation of a RTSP server application based on Java Stream Assembly API. The AspectJ approach was used to implement the adaptability requirements from the RTSP server. Two mechanisms of monitoring and adaptation were developed. Preliminary experimental results show that the solution can improve the quality of service of Internet real-time media transmission. The use of aspect-oriented techniques in the implementation of the adaptation layer also brought benefits to the understanding and maintenance of the adaptation functionalities as well as the base server application requirements.Este trabalho propõe uma arquitetura para uma …
Implementing an Adaptation Layer for Multimedia Servers Using Aspect-Oriented Programming

01: Um Estudo sobre o Uso de Marcações Autocontidas em Vídeo para Promoção de Interação Sensível ao Conteúdo em Múltiplos Contextos

column2: as iniciativas pioneiras de interatividade na TV Digital e nas plataformas de TV Conectada ainda não trouxeram ganhos significativos para o usuário na sua experiência de assistir televisão. Uma limitação relevante é que o conteúdo audiovisual normalmente não dialoga com os recursos de tais plataformas. Neste trabalho nós propomos como abordagem complementar o uso de técnicas de marcação em vídeo para promover interatividade de forma sensível ao conteúdo baseada na criação de âncoras hipermídia autocontidas. As âncoras autocontidas são metadados inseridos de forma sincronizada com a narrativa contendo as informações necessárias que permitam que um agente específico possa conduzir o usuário para contextos diferentes de acordo com a sua interação particular com o conteúdo apresentado. Uma vantagem desta abordagem

column1: O padrão Pipes and Filters [3] descreve um arquitetura de software constituída de componentes que realizam algum tratamento de dados (filters) e conexões que transmitem dados entre esses componentes (pipes)
column2: formando uma cadeia de processos de fluxos de dados (pipeline). Tal solução é utilizada freqüentemente em sistemas que tratam fluxos de dados seqüencial e incrementalmente
column3: tais como protocolos de comunicação e sistemas multimídia. O emprego do padrão permite reutilização e manutenibilidade
column4: uma vez que etapas de um pipeline podem ser facilmente identificadas e separadas em componentes independentes e que podem colaborar entre si. Entretanto
column5: a adição de requisitos de adaptabilidade (por exemplo
column6: reconfiguracão dinâmica no arranjo de componentes) não tem sido bem tratada nessas arquiteturas
column7: ocasionando a adição de problemas de manutenibilidade [4].

01: Incipient fault diagnosis in power transformers by data-driven models with over-sampled dataset
Early diagnosis of incipient faults in power transformers enables their predictive maintenance and guarantees their proper operation. Recently
column2: machine learning (ML) techniques have played special role in fault diagnosis in power transformers; however
column3: the application of such data-driven methods has been hampered by the lack of quality data to support their learning process. Since the collection of dissolved gas analysis (DGA) data depends on equipment failures
column4: the obtaining of large labeled datasets that characterize incipient faults is a difficult task. The use of over-sampling techniques can overcome this challenge by providing a synthetic dataset with balanced classes for the ML method’s learning process. This paper addresses a novel application of a deep neural network classifier for the diagnosis of a dataset enriched by the Borderline synthetic minority over-sampling method. Ferro- or piezoelectrets are dielectric materials with two elastically very different macroscopic phases and electrically charged interfaces between them. One of the newer piezoelectret variants is a system of two fluoroethylenepropylene (FEP) films that are first laminated around a polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) template. Then
column3: a two-layer FEP structure with open tubular channels is obtained. After electrical charging
column4: the channels form easily deformable macroscopic electric dipoles whose changes under mechanical or electrical stress lead to significant direct or inverse piezoelectricity
column6: different PTFE templates are employed to generate channel geometries that vary in height or width. It is shown that the control of the channel geometry allows a direct adjustment of the resonance frequencies in the tubular-channel piezoelectrets. By combining several …

column1: Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
01: Electrostatic characterization of carpets using a corona triode
IEEE 1997 Annual Report Conference on Electrical Insulation and Dielectric Phenomena

This paper is aimed at studying the electrostatic characterization of carpet samples employing the corona triode with constant current. The technique allows electric charges to be deposited and simultaneously obtain information on the dissipation of this excess charge in the sample. Preliminary results show that it is possible to determine the electric resistance and capacitance of the sample. From these data the relaxation time of the sample was estimated. Further details on the charging process are also discussed.

01: Impulse voltage sensor based on electret technology

It is known that lightning produces impulse voltages and currents in distribution and transmission lines. There are a few methods used for measuring peak currents such as magnetic links magnetic tapes and for measuring peak voltages such as electret transducer. The aim of this paper is to take back the research about the electret transducer to install it to the electric system and to show a methodology to calibrate it using a spherical electrode. This sensor consists of a spherical metallic electrode and another flat metallic electrode separated by a piece of dielectric (Teflon FEP). The impulse voltage produces an electric discharge and charges are transferred from the electrode to the dielectric surface
column2: forming the electret. For a more accuracy
column3: the calibration must be made by the pair electrode-sample and different samples made from 50 µm FEP film have no significant influence on the process calibration.

column1: Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
01: Electrical discharges in small air gap
[Proceedings] 1992 Annual Report: Conference on Electrical Insulation and Dielectric Phenomena

Electric discharges in small air gaps (10-300 mu m) were investigated by measuring the charge transferred to a dielectric foil which filled part of the air gap and was subjected to an impulsive high voltage. The Teflon FEP samples were charged (thus forming electrets) if the peak impulse voltage exceeded a threshold value. Measurements were performed in order to investigate the importance of the metallic electrode and the voltage impulse duration. Also discussed are the mechanisms for triggering the discharge in the air gap and the processes for charge transfer to the dielectric.<>

01: Vibration Detection of Vehicle Impact Using Smartphone Accelerometer Data and Long-Short Term Memory Neural Network

column3: traffic behavior analysis can be useful to monitor traffic jams as a smart cities solution. In this paper

Indicating that the methodology is effective in classification of vehicles by their impact vibration.

01: Manutenção pré-corretiva em transformadores de potência: um novo conceito de manutenção

Um importante diferencial competitivo das empresas distribuidoras de energia elétrica é a gestão da utilização dos seus ativos elétricos. Dentre eles destaca-se o transformador de potência em função de sua importância estratégica no fornecimento de energia aos grandes centros de carga. Para minimizar os impactos operacionais e sociais associados às interrupções do fornecimento de energia elétrica
column2: estes equipamentos devem ter suas principais características constantemente monitoradas para que haja controle efetivo e garantia de funcionamento adequado e otimizado. O monitoramento das suas principais características é um ponto crítico que deve ser constantemente aprimorado
column3: pela indiscutível importância destes ativos elétricos na continuidade do fornecimento de energia elétrica. Este trabalho apresenta proposta para avaliação em tempo real de falhas em transformadores de potência
column4: para que sejam monitorados remotamente pela distribuidora
column5: através do seu respectivo Centro de Operação do Sistema Elétrico
column6: propiciando assertividade e rápida tomada de decisão gerencial em ocorrências de falhas internas
column7: reduzindo os custos associados à interrupção do fornecimento de energia elétrica
column8: diminuindo significativamente os tempos de restabelecimento do fornecimento e consequentemente minimizando impactos nos principais indicadores de qualidade operacional da distribuidora

column5: como por exemplo: defeitos no material dielétrico; ruptura mecânica na parte superior dos isoladores em função dos esforços por dilatação do conjunto (rosca e pino); e destruição por causa de atos de vandalismo. Deste modo

column8: comparando-os com os isoladores de porcelana. column3: and the impact of magnetic fields on these devices. Fabricated by fusing fluoroethylene propylene (FEP) films and integrating magnetic strips
column4: the MPT devices exhibit both magnetostrictive and piezoelectric effects in response to external magnetic fields. The study encompasses the latest advancements in material synthesis
column7: and potential device applications. Measurements conducted under various electric currents and frequencies revealed that higher capacitance values are associated with increased electric charge storage in MPT devices. The devices demonstrated exceptional quality factors

column2: RdA Investigation of a Magnetic Levitation Architecture with a Ferrite Core for Energy Harvesting. Energies 2024

column1: This work presents the development of a magnetic levitation system with a ferrite core
column2: designed for electromagnetic energy harvesting from mechanical vibrations. The system consists of a fixed enamel-coated copper coil and five neodymium-iron-boron permanent magnets housed within a PVC spool. To enhance magnetic flux concentration
column3: a manganese-zinc ferrite (Mn-Zn) ring was employed within the spool. Experimental tests were conducted at frequencies up to 20 Hz
column4: demonstrating the device’s potential for harvesting energy from small vibrations
column5: such as those generated by human biomechanical movements
column6: achieving operating voltages up to 3 V. Additionally
column7: the architecture is scalable for larger systems and allows for the integration of multiple transducers without magnetic field interference
column8: independent of the frequency or excitation phase of each transducer.

A piezoelectret-based acoustic transducer was constructed for the purpose of detecting partial discharges (PD) in an energized power transformer located at a power substation. column3: exhibits a frequency response ranging from 5 kHz to 50 kHz
column4: with a pronounced resonance around 30 kHz. To validate the performance of the TPT

column1: Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
01: Current Transducer Based on Magneto-Piezoelectret Thermoformed Technology

This paper introduces a new category of electrical current transducers based on piezoelectrets with thermoformed channels exhibiting magnetic characteristics. These magnetic characteristics gave rise to a new class of piezoelectrets called Thermoformed Magneto-Piezoelectrets (MPTs). Testing the MPTs reaction to external electrical currents showed that these devices respond proportionally to the magnetic fields generated by the applied electrical current. The occurrence of the direct piezoelectric effect is thus verified
column2: and when subjected to magnetic fields produced by electrical currents
column3: the sensor evidenced piezoelectric and piezo-magnetic coefficients of 8300 pC/N and 4980pC/G
column5: the additional layer of magnetostrictive material optimized the piezoelectric characteristics of the MPTs
column6: but also allowed them to respond to external magnetic fields produced by electrical currents.

column6: a study was made on 3D-printed films made of ABS and PLA polymers. The printed films produced using this technique

01: A novel low cost power converter topology for active power injection in low voltage monophasic power line from fuel cells
José Roberto Boffino de Almeida Monteiro
2014 IEEE Applied Power Electronics Conference and Exposition-APEC 2014

This paper presents a novel power converter topology for PEM solid state fuel cells. The proposed topology consists in an integrated DC/DC and DC/AC converters that can inject electrical power from a low voltage fuel cell into a low voltage monophasic line (100–220Vac). As this topology is suitable to step-up low voltages presents in fuel cell stacks output
column2: it can be also applied in photovoltaic solar panels. The proposed topology is derived from the common topology composed by two intermediary converters: a DC/DC step-up converter and a DC/AC converter
column3: or a monophasic inverter bridge. However
column4: both stages of the converter must operate symbiotically so there is no need of DC bus capacitor
column5: which would be a relatively high voltage capacitor
column6: nor even an inductor for the fuel cell output
column7: which is a relatively high current inductor. Thus
column8: high voltage capacitors and high current inductors are avoided. Compared …

column1: A novel low cost power converter topology for active power injection in low voltage monophasic power line from fuel cells

01: Análise da operação de para-raios de linha em sistemas de distribuição de energia elétrica

column8: Av Eng Luiz Edmundo Carrijo Coube

column1: The growing demand for energy efficiency have lead companies to invest serious amount of money to improve their power systems
column2: in what is known as smart-grids. However
column4: the maintenance of the equipment distribution
column6: lightning rods and grounding line system can not be forgotten. In this direction
column7: this work presents an early study of the real conditions of surge arresters that were installed in distribution networks and it shows strong evidence of inadequate maintenance procedures by companies and also that there are poorly designed surge arresters
column8: especially with water infiltration issues. Laboratory tests were conducted by comparing thirty surge arresters that were in service with six new ones.

Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
01: Validation of the forensic analysis applied to distribution transformers (FAADT)
Most Brazilian utility companies normally do not consider failures in distribution transformers to be a great economic issue
column2: since detecting these faults can be more costly in terms of time and resources. Thus
column3: proper policies for investigating faults in distribution transformers are usually disregarded by the power utilities and sometimes policies may not even exist. In this context
column4: existing information on faulty distribution transformers may not contain important data. However
column5: new laws affecting power distribution companies are becoming more severe and there are demands for greater efficiency. In this new scenario
column6: a forensic methodology to analyze faults in distribution transformers
column7: created some years ago by many utilities
column8: has recently been resurrected with the analysis of 3
column9: 159 distribution transformers. This methodology is known as Forensic Analysis Applied to Distribution Transformers (FAADT). This paper
column10: which …

column1: Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
01: Funções de mérito em contornos deformáveis: uma análise global da distância ótima entre os pontos

Este trabalho discute uma metodologia inédita para otimização dos contornos deformáveis paramétricos. Pela intervenção dinâmica na evolução da curva ele supera um problema inerente à snake tradicional de modo a possibilitar
column2: quando do uso de snakes leves
column3: a obtenção de contornos mais fiéis. Em fato
column4: a diferença essencial para a tradicional snake GVF é a definição de uma função de mérito que destaca particularidades no aspecto da curva. O método proposto resolve o problema do agrupamento indevido dos pontos em grandes porções da snake e acessa a potencialidade das forças externas no alcance das regiões côncavas. Será também mostrado para um conjunto de imagens bem parametrizadas que a solução proposta implica em melhores resultados em convergência e casamento.

column1: Funções de mérito em contornos deformáveis: uma análise global da distância ótima entre os pontos

column1: Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
01: Contornos deformáveis adaptativos em imagens médicas
A segmentação é um dos problemas mais significantes em processamento de imagens [1
column2: 2]. Ao mesmo tempo em que é tarefa fundamental em uma grande variedade de aplicações [3]
column3: é ainda de dificuldade considerável. A segmentação de imagens médicas
column5: é ainda um problema desafiador e crucial na área de processamento de imagens.

column2: particularidades dos modelos deformáveis como a tolerância à descontinuidade dos contornos e a sintonia de propriedades como suavidade
column3: os afiguram como solução particularmente útil no processamento de imagens médicas. As aplicações em identificação de lesões de pele [4]
column4: imagens ecocardiográficas [5] e elementos anatômicos [6] são exemplos bastante ilustrativos. Ainda que o uso dos contornos deformáveis seja vasto e crescente
column5: questões como a sua sensibilidade à inicialização

column2: the increasingiy high costs of these timbers and BraziFs new environmental laws have conbributed to change this situation
column3: spurring research on new materiais for application in transmission and distributíon systems. This paper discusses two reforested wood species
column5: coated with castor oil-based polyurethane resins

01: A NOVELL ALGORITHM FOR ACTIVES CONTOUR MODELS: ADAPTIVE SNAKES

We present a novel algorithm to optimize deformable contour models. It overcomes an inherent problem of traditional snakes using a dynamic intervention in the evolution of the curve so that leads to better fidelity in contour detection. In practice
column2: the main difference from the traditional GVF snakes is the definition of a feature merit function. The proposed method solves the problem of points bunching together on strong portions of the contour and achieves fuller matching of concavities with external forces. We also show with a set of wellparameterized images that the proposed solution leads to better convergence and matching.

When the Fall-of-Potential Method or one of its several variations is used to measure substation grounding resistance
column2: the distance from the grid station to the current and voltage test electrodes may affect the accuracy of measurements. For an accuracy of 95% in resistance measuring
column4: as the minimum distance between test electrodes

01: A new methodology for dielectric materials analysis used in polymeric insulators; Uma nova metodologia para analise dos materiais dieletricos usados em isoladores polimericos

Due to many problems regarding insulators installed in electrical energy systems this work intends to develop a new methodology for evaluating dielectric materials employed in the polymeric insulators manufacture processes. As the material to be analyzed it was chosen the originated polyurethane resin from mamona oil due to being genuinely Brazilian and also for having been presenting an excellent performance as a dielectric material. In this new methodology it is going to be employed the microscopy atomic force
column2: the X ray diffraction and the computerized tomography in order to analyse imperfections
column3: composition and homogeneity of dielectric materials. Usually
column4: these factors cause distortions in the electric fields which affect too many insulators performance. The obtained results have been demonstrating that this analysis methodology can be applied on the the known samples as well as on the unknown ones.

column1: A new methodology for dielectric materials analysis used in polymeric insulators; Uma nova metodologia para analise dos materiais dieletricos usados em isoladores polimericos

01: Dielétricos líquidos: um paralelo entre normas e fenômenos físicos

O comportamento elétrico dos dielétricos líquidos ainda está muito aquém de ser completamente entendido. Diversos fenômenos são inexplicáveis e encontram-se na fase de meras observações laboratoriais. Dentro desse universo
column2: normas técnicas eprocedimentos de ensaios são elaborados para orientar os usuários desses materiais em aplicações. Neste contexto
column3: este trabalho procurou inicialmente traçar um paralelo entre as principais pesquisas dos fenômenos físicos e as normas atuais
column4: trazendo inclusive inúmeras contribuições sobre correções que necessitam ser efetuadas em algumas delas. Ponto relevante do trabalho foi também o de desenvolver um procedimento para estudos de novos dielétricos líquidos. Aqui pôde-se estudar oóleo de mamona como dielétrico líquido e definir suas principais aplicações e características desejáveis que venham futuramente a possuir para ser um provável substituto do óleo de transformar

01: Estudo de células de cristais líquidos termotrópicos calamíticos e suas aplicações como sensores eletro-ópticos de tensões elétricas

Esta pesquisa mostrou a viablidade técnica da utilziação de células de cristais líquidos nemáticos (CLNs) como elementos sensores eletro-ópticos de tensões elétricas eficazes (RMS). Duas foram as filosofias abordadas na concepção desses sensores: a modulação em amplitude da intensidade da luz polariza atuando em células transmissivas e a tensão de Freedericksz atuando em células reflexivas. Os snesores baseados na primeir filosofia foram denominados
column3: de sensores de escala de cinza (EC) e os segundos de sensores de gráfico de barras (GB). O sensor EC foi desenvolvido para aplicações em altas tensões. Este sensor é constituído por um divisor de tensão capacitivo
column4: onde o braço de baixa tensão é composto por uma célula de cristal nemático torcida (CLNT). O sensore EC alia as vantagens dos tradicionais sistemas eletro-ópticos
column5: tais como a imunidade às ionterferências eletromagnéticas (IEM); o alto isolamento elétrico proporcionado pela fibra óptica; com as vangatens de ser um sistema com um simples aparato óptico
column6: então indutivo. O sensor GB mostrou-se mais versátil que o sensor EC. Neste sensor o braço de alta tensão do divisor de tensão capacitivo foi confeccionado na própria célula. Além disso
column7: o sensor GB é menos sensível a influências térmicas
column8: sendo neste caso mais indicado para aplicações de campo. Além das vantagens citadas acima
column9: os sensores desenvolvidos apresentam as características de possuírem baixo custo
column10: facilidade de instalação
column11: versatilidade e empregarem tecnologia nacional. Também neste trabalho
column12: foram estudados e determinados modelo físicos e elétricos que …

01: A Didactic Methodology Based in the Fragmentation of Complex Problems of Electrical Engineering
This paper describes a teaching methodology
column2: where the enthusiasm is the lever of learning. Its nucleus consists in presenting complex engineering problems to students
column4: afterwards breaking them into simpler ones. During the discipline
column5: the students are stimulated to solve these simpler problems with special software and hardware tools. As an example of this methodology
column6: syllabus modifications and adaptations in a freshmen course of Electrical Engineering course will be also shown.

column1: Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
01: Contribuição para o estudo da impedância sob impulso
column3: coeficiente de impulso e resistência de malhas de aterramento de subestações

column1: O conhecimento da área efetiva de uma malha de aterramento de subestação elétrica é importante para obter o valor da impedância sob impulso num determinado ponto da malha em situações de incidência de descargas atmosféricas e determinar o nível de impulso básico (NBI). A partir destes valores é possível definir com segurança a disposição dos equipamentos no interior da subestação. Com o objetivo de obter um modelo de malha de aterramento de subestações. são estudadas malhas de aterramento com formas geométricas quadradas até sessenta e quatro sub-malhas e retangulares até setenta e duas sub-malhas. Para análise do comportamento em regime permanente na freqüência industrial e transitório é proposto um modelo de uma linha de transmissão em &# 960
column2: com indutâncias próprias e mútuas e condutâncias lineares. As simulações são feitas em microcomputador e estação de …

01: Medição de tensões e correntes-classe 15 Kv-por sistemas eletro-ópticos e magneto-ópticos
Neste trabalho mostrou-se a viabilidade técnica da construção de um sistema totalmente novo para medir altas tensões e correntes em linhas classe 15 kV
column2: cuja filosofia fundamenta-se no acoplamento de dois sistemas de medidas
column3: um convencional e outro eletro-óptico. O sistema convencional consiste em divisores de tensão e anéis captores e o eletro-óptico
column6: fibras ópticas e receptores. Este sistema foi totalmente testado em laboratório e apresenta como principais características baixo custo
column7: facilidade de instalação e versatilidade. Também neste trabalho foram desenvolvidos dois programas computacionais para a aquisição de dados através de placas GPIB e A/D. Estes programas também permitem processar os dados

01: Electrohydrodynamic instability and electrical discharge initiation in hexane
Proceedings of 1995 Conference on Electrical Insulation and Dielectric Phenomena
An experimental technique is described that tests the hydrodynamic stability of the fluid boundary in a fluid-insulated system: A quasi-uniform field configuration is used and a pulsed
column2: Nd:YAG laser is employed to create a micro-bubble at the surface of one electrode. The gap is pulse-charged and the laser is synchronized with the time-of-application of the voltage pulse. Under appropriate experimental conditions of voltage and laser pulse energy
column3: the bubble evolves to produce full electrical breakdown by the onset and propagation of instabilities in the bubble surface. Experimental data obtained in hexane are presented.

01: Electret transducer for measuring impulse voltages and currents-application in lightning detection
Conference Record of the 1990 IEEE Industry Applications Society Annual Meeting
Impulse current produced by lightning in transmission and distribution lines is studied. A new method of detection of impulse currents is proposed
column2: using electrets as elements of transduction. An impulse voltage
column4: is applied between two electrodes separated by a dielectric (Teflon FEP) with an air gap
column5: producing a Paschen disruptive discharge in the gap and transferring charges from the electrode to the dielectric surface. For plane electrodes
column6: it is found that the mean charge density transferred to the dielectric is proportional to the value of the peak voltage. For cylindrical/plane electrodes
column7: the relationship between the value of the voltage peak and the charged area is also discussed.<>

01: Eletreto-novo sensor de tensões e correntes impulsivas
É bem conhecido que descargas atmosféricas produzem correntes e tensões impulsivas em linhas de transmissão e distribuição de energia elétrica. Usualmente
column2: as medições dos valores de pico são feitas usando dispositivos
column4: elos magnéticos ou lco-lightning current dekector. O principal propósito desta tese é introduzir um novo detetor de picos de correntes e de tensões baseado em eletretos
column6: pequeno volume e grande versatilidade. Nesse contexto
column7: é apresentado um novo método para formar eletretos denominado carregamento de eletretos por descargas elétricas impulsivas. Onde um dielétrico por exemplo o fep-teflon
column8: pode ser carregado em microssegundos. Quando uma tensão impulsiva é aplicada entre dois eletrodos planos separados por uma amostra dielétrica
column9: uma descarga de paschen pode ocorrer e cargas elétricas do eletrodo podem ser transferidas para o dielétrico. Essas cargas são armazenadas em armadilhas energéticas localizadas no intersticio entre a banda de valência e de condução. A densidade média de carga transferida para o dielétrico é proporcional ao valor de pico da tensão. Com outras formas de eletrodos é a área carregada que se correlaciona com a tensão de pico
column10: usando esse método de formação de eletretos foi possível desenvolver um detetor (SPTE) que armazena informações sobre as correntes e tensões impulsivas.

01: Investigation of Thermo-formed Piezoelectret Accelerometer under Different Electrodynamic Vibration Conditions
Accelerometers are essential sensors utilized across various industry applications. They enable precise measurement of acceleration
column8: and consumer electronics. With their versatile functionality
column9: accelerometers play a crucial role in enhancing human safety
column10: improving performance
column11: and driving innovation in modern technology. The demand for new accelerometer technologies led to the use of piezoelectrets as the main sensing element. Piezoelectrets are advanced materials with unique structure and properties
column12: similar to piezoelectric polymers but with enhanced performance due to their cellular microstructure. With promising applications in energy harvesting
column16: their remarkable efficiency and flexibility make them particularly appealing for compact and versatile transducers and actuators. Due to their abilities
column17: piezoelectrets have been employed in the development of accelerometers for monitoring electrodynamic vibrations. Different designs have been proposed and
column19: the concept of an enclosed seismic mass superposing a sensing element is used together with an open tubular channel thermo-formed piezoelectret. The recently enhanced piezoelectret accelerometer
column20: only analyzed in a custom-made workbench
column21: is tested in this paper in a standard electrodynamic vibration setup at frequencies ranging from 50 Hz up to 1 kHz. The results from both custom-made and standard systems are presented for a much better understanding of this type of accelerometer.

column1: Investigation of Thermo-formed Piezoelectret Accelerometer under Different Electrodynamic Vibration Conditions
Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM

column10: JP Carmo

column1: This paper presents an insole made of silicone-based material consisting of four piezoelectric sensors
column2: each of which positioned on the following locations: toe
column3: inner and outer positions of the foot
column4: and heel. This insole serves to identify the gait behavior of Parkinson's disease patients. The first tests with the insole were promising
column5: due to its possibility of obtaining signals of different magnitudes
column6: according to the position of each sensor. The sensor positioned at the heel presented higher magnitude of signal
column7: followed by those positioned at the toe
column8: internal part and external part of the foot.

column1: Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
01: Implementação e caracterização de um método de carregamento baseado no método de carregamento por contato direto

Este artigo tem por objetivos apresentar o dispositivo de carregamento de filmes poliméricos que foi implementado no Grupo de Alta Tensão e Materiais (GATM) e os resultados da caracterização realizada. A necessidade de implementação do dispositivo se deu devido aos avanços realizados pelo grupo na área de eletretos poliméricos e o desenvolvimento de um dispositivo de medidas do potencial de superfície dos filmes utilizados. O método de carregamento é baseado no método de contato direto.
Implementação e caracterização de um método de carregamento baseado no método de carregamento por contato direto
Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
01: A New Route to Polymeric Transducers: 3D Printing of Polypropylene Ferroelectrets
In the quest for new functional materials
column2: ferroelectrets appeared in the late 1990s as a great surprise. Ever since
column3: new preparation schemes and materials geometries have been proposed and demonstrated with several enhancements. Now
column4: another promising approach for producing such materials is presented. Using 3D-printing technology and polypropylene (PP) filaments we were able to print
column5: a two-layered film strucutre with regular cavities precisely distributed. Samples were prepared in a single printing process
column7: and their transducer behavior over time and at various temperatures and pressures were investigated in order to better understand the specific properties of the new structure and the applications-relevant effects of 3D printing and processing. Results revealed that the samples produced by this technique can exhibit a piezoelectricity similar to other PP ferroelectrets ie up to 200 pC/N
column8: and that their temporal and thermo behavior are also in agreement with those better known samples. Finally the pressure analysis shown that these samples present a major sensibility around 20 kPa and 35 kPa
column9: which is characteristic of the 3D samples.

column1: A New Route to Polymeric Transducers: 3D Printing of Polypropylene Ferroelectrets
Professor Pesquisado: RUY ALBERTO CORREA ALTAFIM
